correlations.description: CLI command injection vulnerabilities are common in CLI-based deployment tools (e.g., Jenkins, Ansible), creating similar spoofing risks.

Implement centralized input validation rules

correlations.description: Spoofing and elevation of privilege threats could combine to create persistent system access risks.

summary: Capistrano threats show strong correlations with CLI security patterns, DevOps compliance requirements, and common attack vectors across infrastructure and application systems. Prioritize cross-system input validation, access control standardization, and secret management practices to address overlapping risks.
